title: Emergency Survival Guide
intro_text: This offline-first guide provides step-by-step instructions for the most common emergencies: fire, earthquake, first aid, gas leaks, and road accidents. Access vital information even without an internet connection.
fire_card_desc: Learn what to do in case of a fire at home, work, or outdoors.
earthquake_card_desc: Essential steps to protect yourself during and after an earthquake.
firstaid_card_desc: Quick first aid tips for injuries, burns, bleeding, and more.
gasleak_card_desc: How to recognize and respond to a gas leak safely.
accident_card_desc: What to do if you witness or are involved in a road accident.
offline_notice: You are offline. This guide works without internet.
footer_tip:
This website is built to work offline during real emergencies.
Tip: Download and open it once to ensure offline access later. Stay calm, stay safe, and help others when you can.

fire_step1_desc: Do not panic. Assess the situation quickly.
fire_step2_desc: Leave the building immediately using the nearest safe exit.
fire_step3_desc: If safe, use a fire extinguisher to put out small fires.
fire_step4_desc: Dial emergency services once you are safe.
fire_step5_desc: Never go back inside a burning building.
fire_video_title: Watch: How to Survive a Fire
earthquake_step1_desc: Get down, take cover under sturdy furniture, and hold on.
earthquake_step2_desc: Remain inside until shaking stops. Move away from windows.
earthquake_step3_desc: Carefully exit the building, watching for hazards.
earthquake_step4_desc: Use a battery-powered radio for emergency information.
earthquake_step5_desc: Check for injuries and provide first aid if needed.
earthquake_video_title: Watch: What to Do During an Earthquake
firstaid_step1_desc: Ensure the area is safe before helping.
firstaid_step3_desc: Apply pressure to wounds with a clean cloth.
firstaid_step4_desc: Rinse with clean water if available.
firstaid_step5_desc: Keep the person comfortable and monitor their condition.
gasleak_step1_desc: Do not use electrical switches or flames.
gasleak_step2_desc: Open windows and doors to let gas escape.
gasleak_step4_desc: Contact gas company or emergency services from a safe location.
gasleak_step5_desc: Wait for professionals to declare the area safe.
gasleak_video_title: Watch: What to Do in a Gas Leak
accident_step1_desc: Safely stop your vehicle and turn on hazard lights.
accident_step2_desc: Contact emergency services if there are injuries.
accident_step3_desc: Use warning triangles or flares if available.
accident_step4_desc: Assist injured persons if you can do so safely.
accident_step5_desc: Exchange information and document the scene if safe.
accident_video_title: Watch: What to Do After a Car Accident
